column1: length ball on middle, swings back in a touch, Qdk shows the full face of the bat and offers an extension of a push. Eased straight down the ground, mid-off had no chance, beaten to his right. Was that a statement from Qdk?
short and width outside off, no movement, Qdk flays it away to the left of the diving cover fielder. Races away to the boundary
leg-stump half-volley, possibly a slower one, picked away to the left of mid-on
back of a length on middle, defended
veering into the pads, glanced to short fine leg
Southee nails a off-stump yorker, dug out towards point
banged in short on middle, Iyer fends it back to the bowler
rising short ball on off, 132ks, the batsman hops and fends another one, this one wanders towards point
hurled short and just a shade outside off, leaves the batsman fending again. Iyer camps back and manages an inside edge onto the pad
keeps it short, angled in. The left-hander stays back and fends it towards mid-on off an inside edge
banged in short, cranks up to 141ks, rushes on top of off, jabbed to the covers

Mitchell McClenaghan roars! He gets the big scalp of Qdk. Back of a length, angled in, Qdk targets the leg side with a slog. He can only skew it into the hands of Hardik at backward point. Simple catch. The other Pandya hugs McClenaghan. The batsman examines the toe end of the bat as he walks off
slides down the leg side
back of a length on off, punchily defended to cover
full and veering into the pads again, Iyer manages an inside edge to the leg side
bumper down leg, sails over the ducking batsman. Parthiv leaps and takes it. Wide called
back of a length and on off, Samson comes forward and pushes to mid-on
back of a length and angled in on off, whipped away through backward square leg
Southee runs in hard, hits the deck and hammers a short ball that climbs on off. Dabbed towards point
length and outside off, slashed to third man off the outside edge
back of a length and angled across the right hander, steered down to third man
short and angled away, slashed to the right of third man
this is pitched up and angles away outside off, the batsman is dragged into a booming drive. He does not move his feet and does not connect
follows it with a rushing short ball on off, Iyer makes room and jabs it to the off side off an inside edge. He looked ungainly there
nice and full on off, Iyer likes it there. He frees his arms and drills a drive straight over the bowler's head
this is even better. MM retorted with a short ball outside off, Iyer stepped away, opened up the off side, and slapped it flat and hard over cover for a six!
starts off with a short ball, angled in from over the wicket, blocked
gorgeous timing. Fuller and angled in on off, not a half-volley, Sanju hits on the up and drives it over the head of <s>Qdk</s> Iyer, beats mid-on to his left
back of a length on off, guided to backward point
length ball, angling in around off again, defended to point
length ball on off, punchily driven to mid-off
angling into the pads, flicked away behind square on the leg side
slides in with the arm, beats the flick, and hits the pad
the batsman steps out and moves away, Krunal is wary of it. He follows him and fires it. He aims to flick and gets an inside edge to leg
darted down leg, wide
length ball on off, no turn, worked to the midwicket
full and straight, shuffles across and clips through the same region
length ball, drifts in, and stops on Iyer. He checks his attempted push and lobs it in the air. Just clears Krunal via a leading edge. They take a single by the time the ball reaches long-off
punched down to long-off for one
back of a length and outside off, helped to third man for one
short and on the pads, glanced to fine leg
good length ball outside off, Samson pushes and nicks it to the right of the diving keeper
full and straight, bunted to long-on
fullish and around off, run away to point

Hardik Pandya strikes in his first over. Back of a length and outside off, Iyer wants to go across the line. He slogs and skies it off an outside edge. Rayudu runs in from sweeper cover and completes a good catch
full on the off stump, no turn, Karun employs the reverse sweep and hits it through backward point
tossed up on off, defended to mid-on
glanced to short fine leg
eased down the ground for one
slides on outside off, the batsman stretches across off and misses the sweep as the ball wanders away to short third man

Two wickets in two overs. Floated up on off, Nair goes low for a sweep and top-edges it to Southee at fine leg. He nailed a reverse sweep in his first ball but falls to the conventional sweep. Harbhajan has the last laugh and blows Karun a goodbye kiss. Daredevils' batting looks lighter now
slides on outside off, patted through the covers
speared on middle and leg, tucked through square leg
down the track and clipped to long-on for one
glanced off the pads to short fine leg
length ball on middle, stops a bit on Duminy. He checks his shot and bunts it to long-on
fired on middle, Krunal is zipping it through. Driven to long-on for one more
flat and darted on middle, punched back to the bowler
shortish offbreak, he makes room and punches it to sweeper cover from outside leg
drifting down leg, diverted off the pad to short fine leg
flat and outside off, eased to sweeper cover again
looped up on middle, tip and run single in front of cover for one. Mumbai needed a direct throw from Hardik there
slider on middle, hangs back and clips it through midwicket
around-arm ball on the pads,  nudged behind square on the leg side
late-cut from the stumps to short third man for one
full and straight, dabbed straight to midwicket
back of a length and skids off the surface on middle, rocks away outside leg and forces it to long-off
slid through outside off, Duminy coils across off and milks a single in front of midwicket
Krunal tosses one up for a change, flicked through square leg
That's h-u-g-e! Tossed on off, Samson races down the track, meets the pitch, and launches it over long-on. He holds his pose and admires the shot. He timed the pants off it
hurrying length ball, blocked back to the bowler
flighted on off, Samson goes for a sweep. Hits it in the air. Pierces the gap between deep square leg and fine leg
fired short from round the wicket, backs away and punches through the covers. Buttler dives and cuts it off to two
slid through on off, dabbed towards point
leg-stump ball, Duminy rolls his wrists and sweeps through backward square leg
hurled at 97ks, slogged from outside off to long-on
drifts into the pads, picked away to deep midwicket
short and wide outside off, cuts firmly to sweeper cover

length ball on the off stump, the batsman rolls his wrists and sweeps it well. Hardik Pandya, running to his left from deep backward square leg and Buttler, running to his right from deep midwicket, collide. Buttler's chest bumps into Pandya's face. Nasty collision. Hardik is down. Looks like he is in great pain. Pandya has been lifted off the field. Pandya's lower body flung over the ad boards after colliding with Buttler. The ball was touching his back during that moment. That's a four.
length ball on off, patted to cover
floated on middle, driven smoothly to long-on
slower length ball on off, tapped to long-on
full and outside off, driven to cover
full slower ball just a shade outside off, Duminy dances out and clouts it over long-on for a six
back of a length on off, Pollard rolls his fingers across this one too, 107ks, bunted to long-on. They hare across for two
short and outside off, another slower ball, swatted to long-on
length and just outside off, punched down to long-on. Samso reaches his half-century
shortish and outside off, late-cut away past point
hurrying short ball on off, swatted to short fine leg, a fumble allows a single
back of a length and outside off, run away to point
short and slid down leg
dug in on off, punched to deep midwicket
drifting into the pads, glanced to fine leg
full toss, angled away outside off, sliced to short third man. There is a mix-up between the wickets. A direct hit could have had Duminy at the non-striker's end
Samson steps out, Bumrah bowls a 113ks slower ball outside off and dupes the batsman. He flicks early and misses
full and outside off, another slower one, 112ks, run away towards point
too full and outside off, eased to sweeper cover
nails a yorker on middle and leg, driven to long-on
full and outside off, Duminy shuffles across the off stump and scoops it over the keeper's head for four
full and angled away outside off, the batsman swings, loses his shape, and does not make contact
banged in short and outside off, Samson is up to the challenge. He slugs it over the wide long-on boundary
rolls his fingers across a slower ball, floats it too wide outside off

MM aims for a yorker, pushes a full toss below the waistline. Samson aims to crash it over long-off. No dice, he holes out to Southee, running to his right. Samson mis-hit it, possibly off the bottom part of the bat. They check for a front foot no-ball. MM is okay. They now check if that's a beamer. MM is fine on this count too. Samson is gone
short and angled away from round the wicket, Duminy lays into a square cut and sends it to the fence
short and angled away outside off again, chopped behind to the keeper off a bottom edge
wide yorker, inside the tramline, left lone
yorker at the base of off, 139ks, JP Duminy carves it away to the left of third man. Harbhajan dives belatedly. Looks like a reluctant drive. A yorker has been squeezed for four. Well done, Duminy
yorker outside off, Duminy reaches out but can't carve this away
pitched up and outside off, squirted to the covers
slid down leg, wide
slower ball on middle, with extra bounce, dabbed on the pitch for one
pretty full on off, driven to sweeper cover. Duminy wants two. JP dives full-length and makes his ground. A direct hit from Rayudu could have had Negi. Duminy gives his partner a thumbs-up
full and aimed at off, jammed to sweeper cover
yorker outside off, Negi slogs and gets an inside edge behind to the keeper. Parthiv dives to his right and stops the ball
length and too wide outside off
Negi swings his bat again, but can't connect. MM spears it wide outside off
cutter outside off, slashes and misses
slower bouncer, 127ks, Negi is early into the pull and is hit on the helmet. The ball drops in front of short third man
shorter and outside off, dragged to square leg off the inside half
low full toss outside off, carved to the covers
too full and outside off, drilled down the ground
yorker on the leg stump, swatted to long-on
Duminy shuffles across off to open up the leg side. This is full, Duminy slogs and manages an inside edge
banged in short, Negi steps away, then steps back to adjust to the length. He slams it for four over midwicket; one bounce
Negi moves outside leg, Bumrah nails a leg-stump yorker. Dug out
Bumrah can't nail a yorker. He pushes a full toss. What does Duminy do? He shuffles across off, takes it from off stump and scoops it over fine leg for a six!

Bumrah can't get the yorker right, again. He has to settle with a full toss on middle. Duminy, who is outside the crease, slogs to the leg side and skies a catch. Parthiv settles under the top edge. Replays show this is above the waistline. Bumrah has walked off. He has to come back and re-bowl it. Rohit isn't happy
finishes off with a leg-stump full toss, swatted to long-on. They hare across for the second
length and wobbles into the pads, easy pickings for Rohit. Flicked through backward square leg

short on off, dabbed to short midwicket. Rohit takes a couple of steps forward, Parthiv responds and sets off. Rohit then sends him back and calls 'no' 'no'. Iyer swoops down on the ball, but can't nail the stumps down with a side-arm throw. Samson backs it up at mid-on

ah, caught behind? Full and Zak rolls his fingers across this one that cuts away. The batsman prods and misses. Qdk though he had his man there. He went up right away. Zak joined the appeal later. The umpire did not budge
full and cuts away outside off, Rohit prods and misses
Zak rolls his fingers across another full ball that leaves Rohit in the channel. He is beaten again. Three in a row

pitched up on off, may have stopped a bit on the batsman. He checks his shot and drives it up and over the covers for four. What an eventful first over. Rohit leans into the shot. Sachin applauds from the dug out
full and aimed at off, patted to mid-off
full and swerves in at 140ks, Parthiv is caught on the crease. He gets an inside edge past the leg stump
back of a length and rushes on outside off, 143ks, jabbed to point

Parthiv Patel is caught short, despite a full-stretch dive.  Lifting short ball outside off, 143ks, Parthiv goes for a pull and hits it through backward square leg. Iyer runs across from deep square leg, collects the ball, and flings an accurate throw to Qdk. He whips the bails off. Parthiv is a yard short. Replays show that Parthiv dived after Qdk broke the stumps
full and swings away outside off, Rayudu reaches out and misses
back of a length and outside off, crunched through backward point for four
yorker on off, opens the face of the bat and squeezes it between point and backward point
dropped short and wide outside off, Rohit cuts in the gap between point and backward point
slider outside off, inside edged past the off stump, beating the keeper
skiddy short ball on off, Rohit pulls it away to the long-on boundary
pitched up and outside off, tapped behind point
too full and outside off at 93ks, Rayudu opens the face and eases it in the gap at point
back of a length and outside off, punched to mid-off
back of a length and outside off, Rohit stands tall and elegantly drives it to the left of mid-off. The fielder dives and fumbles
full and outside off, run away towards third man
short and wide outside off, slashed to backward point
length and comes in from outside off, Rayudu slogs and drags it to the fine leg boundary off a thick inside edge
Rayudu shuffles across off, this is speared full on middle. He puts it away to the midwicket boundary with a flick. Mumbai are racing away
good length and outside off, skewed to third man off an outside edge
zipping short ball outside off, beats Rayudu's nervous prod away from the body
short and zings through outside off at 142ks, past the swinging bat of Rayudu
delicious full toss on middle, only punched to mid-on

Duminy can't hang on to the catch at slip. Short and zipping through outside off again, Rayudu slashes hard as the outside edge flies to slip. Duminy leaps, attempts the catch with both hands, but the ball bursts through. Morris applauds Duminy's commitment
back of a length and outside off, guided to point
full and outside off, run down to third man
pitched up and swings away outside off, beats the outside edge again
back of a length on middle, dropped in front of point for one
short on off, helped to third man
keeps it short around off, tapped down to third man
back of a length on off, Rayudu secures another single to third man
tossed up and outside off, front-foot drive to long-off
shorter and outside off, high-elbow punch to long-off for one
full on middle, blocked on the front foot
full on middle, stops on the batsman, chipped to mid-off
straight in line, turned behind square. They hare across for the second
slides on off, patted to cover
fired outside off, driven to long-off
low full toss on middle, tucked away through midwicket
pushed through on off, run away to point
legbreak outside off, tapped to point
full and skids on middle, pushed back to the bowler on the front foot
dipping full toss on middle, bunted to long-on
down the track and laced to long-off
slider on middle, nudged to midwicket

The middle stump is tiled back. Mishra pumps his fist. Mishra lets rip a tossed-up googly. Rayudu dances down the track, swings, and does not connect. He did not pick that at all. His stumps are splayed
skiddy ball on middle, pushed to long-on
flighted on off, dabbed to cover with soft hands

slides on middle and leg, Krunal connects with a slog sweep and sends it flat over deep midwicket. Iyer runs across and dives to his left near the boundary. He only comes second to the power of Krunal
full on middle, driven to long-on
flat on off, knocked to long-on
pretty full on off, defended back to the bowler
skids on outside off, angled to short third man for a quick one
googly outside off, curves away outside off, waits and dabs it late, fine to third man fence, beating Zak
flighted on off, whipped to long-on with a flourish
full and swerves in, inside edged onto the pad
back of a length on middle, Krunal turns on style and finesse. This is a cutter from Shami. Krunal waits on it, arches his back, and ramps it to third man for four
Shami muscles a short ball and cramps the batsman for room, beats the pull. The ball hits the body and dribbles behind to the keeper
banged in short, Krunal shuffles across off and misses the pull. Not wided. The ball trampolines over the leg stump
full and on middle, shuffles across and works it to midwicket
pitched up and outside off, pushed through the covers
slider on middle, flicked to deep midwicket
darted outside off, googly, smoked over long-on with a slog sweep
googly again, outside off, Krunal blasts it over long-on again, one-bounce four
fired outside off, flayed to the right of Negi at long-off for a couple
googly, moves away, Krunal targets the leg side and ends up chipping a leading edge to long-off
lobbed up on off, squirted to backward point
length and outside off, possibly a slower ball. With mid-off up, the batsman lofts over the fielder
chest-high short ball, Krunal shapes to pull and flaps to midwicket
short and comes in on off, slapped to long-on

Zak fires a direct hit at the non-striker's end. Pandya dives but is caught short. Superb work from Zak. He hurls a chest-high short ball, Rohit can only fend it back to the bowler. Krunal drifts off in search of a single. Zak runs in, spins back, and nails the stumps down with an over-arm throw. Rohit has been involved in another run out. Krunal goes
back of a length on off, turned to square leg for one
back of a length and outside off, guided towards point
short and outside off, crunched to deep cover
length and outside off, pushed to short cover
banged in short and outside off, swivels on the back foot and swat-pulls it to deep square leg
short and ducks in, deflected square on the leg side
full and swerves in, poked to the leg side off an inside edge
slower ball on off, bunted towards long-on
slow legbreak outside off, nudged to short cover for one
googly on off, Buttler reverse sweeps and misses

Amit Mishra sets off on a celebratory run, a la Tahir. He jumps onto Morris. The googly does the trick. Buttler doesn't spot it. He plays across the line and is rapped on the back pad in front of middle. The finger goes up
tossed up and drifts, inside edged to the leg side
full on middle and leg, patted to the vacant midwicket region
skiddy googly, worked to deep square leg
slides on flat on off, punched to long-off
Tahir bowls a googly, Pollard prods and keeps it out off an inside edge
clipped off the pads to midwicket
legbreak on off, dabbed in front of point. Qdk hunts the ball down, but can't fire a direct hit. Pollard could have been run out
googly, fizzes in off the surface, and hits the thigh pad
this is a legbreak, slogged to deep midwicket off the inside half
lobs it up outside off, hint of turn, hacked to long-on
flighted and outside off, cracks a drive through the covers and brings up his fifty, his third in IPL 2016
flat on middle, pushed back to the bowler
turned off the pads to the right of midwicket. Pollard struggles on the second but makes it
Mishra unfurls the googly again. Pollard loses his shape as he can't connect with a leg-side slog. His back foot was momentarily in the air. But he grounded it by the time Qdk whipped the bails off
another fizzing googly, catches the pad and sneaks away to the leg side
Morris aims a slower ball and slides it down leg
full and outside off, Pollard backs away and drills to long-off
near yorker on off, driven to deep cover. Just a single
back of a length and slipping down leg, may have brushed the pad on its way to the keeper
Pollard rocks away outside leg, Morris nails it at the base of leg, this is a heat-seeking yorker. Jammed to long-on
short ball on middle, pulled away in the gap between deep midwicket and long-on. Nair runs to his left from deep midwicket and lobs it to JP at long-on. Good tag-team work
Rohit now beats JP to his left at long-on. Length ball on middle, belted straight down the ground
banged in short and outside off, sits up outside off. Pulled over midwicket. Negi held back in the deep and opted to  take it on the bounce. Zak isn't happy
full and heading down leg, wide
yorker on the leg stump, Pollard camps back and manages an inside edge on the pad. Dravid applauds from the dug out
Rohit shuffles outside leg, Zak follows him and spears a yorker. Rohit can't touch it
full on middle, slugged to long-on. Iyer keeps it to one
Zak misses the yorker, pushes a full toss on the off stump. Pollard dispatches it over the wide long-on boundary

Six and out! Zak is mobbed by his team-mates.'Khan is the man' flashes on the big screen. Dravid is on his feet. Pollard makes room outside leg, Zak bowls a cutter. Miscued in the air. Morris runs to his right from sweeper cover and pouches a smart catch
low full toss on off, swung away to long-off
length and outside off, Rohit slaps it over long-on. Crucial six. First off Morris in IPL 2016

Rohit Sharma is down in pain near the middle of the pitch. Hardik is involved in his second collision of the day. Overpitched and outside off, drilled to deep cover. Miscommunication between the wickets, Morris fumbles, and there is a mid-pitch collision. Rohit is gone. It's all happening at the Kotla. The throw from Negi first came to Morris. The South Africa fast bowler did not collect the throw and broke the stumps. Pandya wasn't even in the picture. Morris recovered, collected the ball, and then threw it to Qdk. Rohit had collided with Hardik and collapsed near the middle of the pitch. Qdk gleefully breaks the stumps. Rohit is gone. The physio helps him off the field. A three-man tag-team effort does it for Daredevils. Heartbreak for Mumbai
pin-point yorker on middle, Harbhajan makes room, swings and is rapped on the pad. Plumb. Million-dollar Morris is doing the job for Daredevils
Morris nails another yorker, superb accuracy, Southee can only eke out an inside edge
low full toss outside off, sliced over the covers. Daredevils win!
